answers.answer: Hi.  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  Just to be clear, if you have pre-diabetes (and I'm not saying that you are), it's not a question of if you will develop diabetes, but when.  Keeping your a1c low will not prevent diabetes, but it will continue to keep you healthy.  Simply having a good a1c doesn't mean you cannot have diabetes.A fasting glucose test can be taken at any time, you just need to coordinate that with your doctor's office, so you know how long you need to fast.

question: My a1c was 5.9  and glucose was 133.I am eating appropriately for a person with diabetes.I am hoping to avoid getting full blown diabetes. I want to make sure from the beginning I get the proper lab tests to avoid mistakes in my diagnosis.AT what point do I get a fasting insulin test? I read somewhere, cannot recall, but the article said that the A1c must be given ALONG WITH a fasting insulin to get accurate results.IS this correct? thank you
title: Fasting Insulin Test
